Question: The human papillomavirus plays a role in causing cancer of the: A. Ovary B. Rectum C. Anus D. Testicle E. Bladder
Obesity is a risk factor for tumors of the: A. Skin B. Bones C. Endometrium D. Lung E. Thyroid
Among tumor suppressor genes: A. K-RAS B. BRCA C. P-53 D. ATM E. RB
The reciprocal translocation between chromosomes 8 and 14 causes: A. Mantle lymphoma B. Burkitt lymphoma C. Hodgkin lymphoma D. Multiple myeloma E. Acute lymphoblastic leukemia
Preventive surgery for cancer is beneficial in cases of: A. Fibrocystic breast disease B. Polycystic kidney disease C. Polycystic ovary syndrome D. Celiac disease E. Familial polyposis
Among the palliative treatments for malignant ascites: A. Chemotherapy for abdominal tumors B. Abdominal radiation therapy C. Diuretics D. Repeated paracentesis E. Peritoneovenous shunt
Palliative surgery is indicated for cancer patients in cases of: A. Loss of appetite B. Neutrophilia C. Bone marrow tumor invasion D. Hypercalcemia E. Pathological fractures

Regarding doubling time (Doubling Time): A. Hematologic tumors have a longer doubling time than solid tumors B. The average doubling time for most tumors is 2-3 days C. A tumor requires 30 doublings to reach a size of 1 cm D. A tumor requires 30 doublings to grow from 1 g to 1 kg E. A tumor with a diameter of 1 cm contains a million cells
Answer: C. A tumor requires 30 doublings to reach a size of 1 cm

Question: Combined chemoradiation therapy before surgery is beneficial for tumors of the: A. Appendix B. Cecum C. Transverse colon D. Sigmoid E. Rectum

Palliative radiation therapy is beneficial in: A. Relieving pain caused by liver metastases B. Treating lymphedema after axillary clearance C. Stopping diarrhea D. Treating spinal cord compression E. Treating pleural effusion

The administration of adjuvant radiation therapy for endometrial tumors depends on: A. Tumor size B. Contraindications to chemotherapy C. Elevated tumor markers D. Depth of myometrial invasion E. Preoperative vaginal bleeding

The photon beams used in cancer treatment are: A. Electromagnetic waves B. Massless C. Charge-less D. May result from the braking of electron beams E. May result from the breakdown of radioactive isotope nuclei
The tissues with early response in radiation therapy are: A. Bladder mucosa B. Gastric mucosa C. Vascular endothelium D. Bone marrow E. Skin epidermis

Regarding the late effects of radiation therapy: A. Are self-limiting B. Occur 6 weeks after radiation therapy C. Occur only within the radiation field D. Are associated with acute reactions E. Are not related to the dose per session
Answer: C. Occur only within the radiation field

Question: Fractionation in radiation therapy allows healthy cells to: A. Repair B. Repopulate C. Reconstruct D. Re-oxygenate E. Redistribute
Among the drugs used as a chemotherapeutic adjunct and sensitizer for radiation therapy in laryngeal tumors: A. Cyclophosphamide B. Bleomycin C. Vincristine D. Cisplatin E. Gemcitabine
Radiation therapy is used as a standalone curative treatment for tumors of the: A. Lip B. Vocal cord C. Breast D. Prostate E. Stomach

Regarding the late effects of radiation therapy: A. Are self-limiting B. Occur 6 weeks after radiation therapy C. Occur only within the radiation field D. Are associated with acute reactions E. Are not related to the dose per session
Answer: C. Occur only within the radiation field

Question: The electron beams used in cancer treatment are generated by: A. Gamma knife B. Linear accelerator C. Cyclotron D. Cobalt E. Cesium
Among the antiandrogens used in oncology: A. Letrozol B. Exemestane C. Flutamide D. Fulvestrant E. Ifosfamide
The cobalt-60 treatment device is characterized by generating: A. Electrons B. X-rays C. Gamma rays D. Infrared rays E. Ultraviolet rays
The BCG vaccine can be used in the treatment of: A. Acute lymphoblastic leukemia B. Bladder cancer C. Stomach cancer D. Lung cancer E. Nasopharyngeal cancer
Interleukin-2 can be used in the treatment of: A. Acute myeloid leukemia B. Melanoma C. Ovarian cancer D. Anal cancer E. Cervical cancer
Imatinib is used as a first-line treatment for: A. CML B. CLL C. AML D. MM E. MS
Among the drugs targeting vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF): A. Cetuximab B. Trastuzumab C. Bevacizumab D. Rituximab E. Erlotinib
Among the drugs targeting the BRAF mutation: A. Lapatinib B. Vemurafinib C. Erlotinib D. Gefitinib E. Sunitinib
Interferon-alpha can be used in the treatment of (except): A. Myeloid leukemia B. Melanoma C. Prostate cancer D. Renal cell carcinoma E. Carcinoid tumor
